memories: BrowserTools MCP requires NodeJS, Chrome/Chromium browser, and MCP client (Cursor, Windsurf, RooCode, Cline, Continue, Zed, Claude Desktop).
BrowserTools MCP installation uses exact versions: @agentdeskai/browser-tools-mcp@1.2.0 for MCP server and @agentdeskai/browser-tools-server@1.2.0 for server component.

Chrome extension must be downloaded from GitHub releases (https://github.com/AgentDeskAI/browser-tools-mcp/releases/download/v1.2.0/BrowserTools-1.2.0-extension.zip) and installed in Developer Mode as unpacked extension.
BrowserTools MCP server configuration in Cursor: Settings > Features > MCP Servers, name 'browser-tools', command type 'command', command 'npx @agentdeskai/browser-tools-mcp@1.2.0'.
BrowserTools server runs on port 3025 using 'npx @agentdeskai/browser-tools-server@1.2.0' - terminate existing processes on this port before starting.
Chrome Developer Console must be open (right-click > Inspect) in target browser tab to activate BrowserTools logging and monitoring.

BrowserTools troubleshooting: Screenshot failures require explicit version specification, missing screenshots check Downloads/mcp-screenshots directory, no logs means dev tools not open in target tab.
BrowserTools logs are session-based and cleared on page refresh or server restart - this is expected behavior, not a bug.
BrowserTools provides console logs, XHR monitoring, screenshots with Cursor auto-paste, DOM element access, Lighthouse scans, NextJS SEO audits, Debugger Mode, and Audit Mode.
Model Context Protocol requires Anthropic models - use Claude 3.5 Sonnet with Composer agent enabled in Cursor for BrowserTools MCP functionality.
